content: Supabase Auth should be handled on the frontend. The backend should only verify JWTs and use the service role key for server-side operations. Never expose the service role key to the client.
For RLS, create policies that allow the service role full access and restrict anon key to the rows the user is allowed to see. Use (auth.uid() = user_id) for per-user tables.
Pro plan includes 50k vector embeddings per month. Overage is $0.10 per 1k embeddings. Enterprise has custom limits and SLA.
POST /api/chat accepts JSON: message (string), session_id (optional), user_id (optional). Always send session_id for multi-turn; send user_id for memory and user_context.
If the agent returns 500, check: (1) NVIDIA_API_KEY and rate limits, (2) Supabase connection and RLS, (3) tool timeouts. Logs include 'Agent error' and 'Supabase save error'.
